Valiant-CuriosityJan 28 at 9:20 PM

I'm a lot older than the typical Oculus Player. Maybe that is why I enjoy this game. It is great exercise. I have a large area to use when I use the Oculus. I don't play the scramble. Personally, I didn't care for it. I simply set the game up to play traditionally.

The Sports Scramble world is comical. You are placed in a tennis, bowling, or baseball cartoon. It is a happy place to go. You move around as you strike the balls. You also have the option to set the levels for play (easy, normal, expert).

As others have noted, the one fault of Sports Scramble is that it is a "pain" to have to set up the game to play traditional sports each time that you play. I wish the developers would give us an update to save the game settings automatically. That way, you could jump directly into the sports without having to fiddle around with the initial setup. That is the primary reason for my 4 rather than 5 star rating.

The game is similar to Wii Sports . I'd love to see more sports or an exercise camp added.

If you are like me, and you liked Wii Sports or if you would simply like a little exercise along with some fun in a 3d cartoon world, you might enjoy Sports Scramble.

FinnyWiggenMay 23, 2019 at 6:18 AM
Really Fun, but some major flaws

This is one of the funnest games that I have played thus far on Quest. However it currently has some major flaws.

Firstly it crashes roughly 1 out of 3 times that I try to start it. Usually requiring me to completely restart my Quest. Which is frustrating considering the second flaw. Which is that this program takes forever to startup. Then once it has started, you still have to go through multiple menus before you can even start playing the game. Some of these menus require you to pause and listen to a tip, or listen to the announcer say the same thing he says every time. There is no way to skip any of this.

One of the most powerful features of the Oculus Quest is how quickly you can start playing games as compared to the Rift. This is because you can just grab it, put it on, and start playing. Sadly, this game undoes all of those advantages.

If you are going to play you had better plan on three or four minutes before you can even start this game, and that is if it doesn't crash. If it crashes, then you will have an additional four or five minutes to restart the quest and then open the app again.

Having said that, this is a really fun and addictive game. One of the best on the platform. Hoping that they fix all the issues so that it can be truly great.
